subtitle: A wonderful change from quiche! This savoury cheesecake is served cold - perfect for a buffet.

ingredients.ingredient: soft cheese with garlic and herbs

method.text: Sift the flour and salt into a bowl. Place the water and lard in a saucepan. Heat gently until melted. Pour into the flour mixture. Stir well until a soft smooth dough has been achieved.
Knead until smooth on a lightly floured surface. Then, using your knuckles, press the dough into the base and halfway up the sides of the cake tin. Chill until required.
Preheat oven to 160°C. Preheat grill to a medium heat. Lightly grease a 20 cm round spring-clip cake tin.
Heat the oil in a saucepan. Add the onion. Fry for 2-3 min until softened. Leave to cool slightly. Grill the bacon for 3-5 min until cooked. Set aside.
Beat together well, the cream cheese and egg yolk. Stir in the flour, mustard, creme fraiche, cheese, tomato and cooled onion. Cut the bacon into fine strips. Stir into the mixture. Season to taste.
Whisk the egg whites until firm but not dry. Fold into the filling mixture.
Spoon into the prepared base. Smooth over the surface. Arrange the tomato slices around the edge. Sprinkle on the breadcrumbs and cheese.
Place on a baking tray in the oven and cook for 1 hour or until firm to the touch.
Turn off the oven. Leave the door ajar and leave to cool. Serve chilled.

title: Tomato, Parmesan and bacon cheesecake
